Name: dailyMessageQuotaUsed
Description: Number of total messages used today

Name: d2c.telemetry.ingress.sendThrottle
Description: Number of throttling errors due to device throughput throttles

Name: d2c.telemetry.egress.dropped
Description: The number of times messages were dropped by IoT Hub routing due to dead endpoints. This value does not count messages delivered to fallback route as dropped messages are not delivered there.

Name: Disk Read Operations/Sec
Description: Disk Read IOPS

Name: Disk Write Operations/Sec
Description: Disk Write IOPS

Name: Percentage CPU
Description: The percentage of allocated compute units that are currently in use by the Virtual Machine(s)

Name: OS Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of operating system disk I/Os consumed per minute

Name: Data Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of data disk I/Os consumed per minute

Name: Outbound Flows
Description: Outbound Flows are number of current flows in the outbound direction (traffic going out of the VM)

Name: Inbound Flows
Description: Inbound Flows are number of current flows in the inbound direction (traffic going into the VM)

Name: Available Memory Bytes
Description: Amount of physical memory, in bytes, immediately available for allocation to a process or for system use in the Virtual Machine

Name: VmAvailabilityMetric
Description: Measure of Availability of Virtual machines over time.

Name: Network In Total
Description: The number of bytes received on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Incoming Traffic)

Name: Network Out Total
Description: The number of bytes out on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Outgoing Traffic)

Name: Network In
Description: The number of billable bytes received on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Incoming Traffic) (Deprecated)

Name: Percentage CPU
Description: The percentage of allocated compute units that are currently in use by the Virtual Machine(s)

Name: Data Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of data disk I/Os consumed per minute. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: OS Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of operating system disk I/Os consumed per minute. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: Available Memory Bytes
Description: Amount of physical memory, in bytes, immediately available for allocation to a process or for system use in the Virtual Machine

Name: Network In Total
Description: The number of bytes received on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Incoming Traffic)

Name: Network Out Total
Description: The number of bytes out on all network interfaces by the Virtual Machine(s) (Outgoing Traffic)

Name: VmAvailabilityMetric
Description: Measure of Availability of Virtual machines over time.

Name: OS Disk Bandwidth Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of operating system disk bandwidth consumed per minute. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: Inbound Flows
Description: Inbound Flows are number of current flows in the inbound direction (traffic going into the VM)

Name: Data Disk Bandwidth Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of data disk bandwidth consumed per minute. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: Outbound Flows
Description: Outbound Flows are number of current flows in the outbound direction (traffic going out of the VM)

Name: Data Disk Queue Depth
Description: Data Disk Queue Depth(or Queue Length)

Name: CPU Credits Remaining
Description: Total number of credits available to burst. Only available on B-series burstable VMs

Name: OS Disk Queue Depth
Description: OS Disk Queue Depth(or Queue Length)

Name: VM Cached IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of cached disk IOPS consumed by the VM. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: VM Cached Bandwidth Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of cached disk bandwidth consumed by the VM. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: VM Uncached IOPS Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of uncached disk IOPS consumed by the VM. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: VM Uncached Bandwidth Consumed Percentage
Description: Percentage of uncached disk bandwidth consumed by the VM. Only available on VM series that support premium storage.

Name: Disk Write Operations/Sec
Description: Disk Write IOPS

Name: OS Disk Write Bytes/sec
Description: Bytes/Sec written to a single disk during monitoring period for OS disk

Name: CPU Credits Consumed
Description: Total number of credits consumed by the Virtual Machine. Only available on B-series burstable VMs

Name: Data Disk Write Bytes/sec
Description: Bytes/Sec written to a single disk during monitoring period

Name: Disk Read Operations/Sec
Description: Disk Read IOPS

Name: Data Disk Max Burst IOPS
Description: Maximum IOPS Data Disk can achieve with bursting

Name: Data Disk Read Operations/Sec
Description: Read IOPS from a single disk during monitoring period

Name: Disk Write Bytes
Description: Bytes written to disk during monitoring period

Description: Write IOPS from a single disk during monitoring period

Name: OS Disk Max Burst IOPS
Description: Maximum IOPS OS Disk can achieve with bursting

Name: Disk Read Bytes
Description: Bytes read from disk during monitoring period

Name: OS Disk Write Operations/Sec
Description: Write IOPS from a single disk during monitoring period for OS disk

Name: TotalRequests
Description: Number of requests made

Name: NormalizedRUConsumption
Description: Max RU consumption percentage per minute

Name: ServiceAvailability
Description: Account requests availability at one hour, day or month granularity

Name: TotalRequestUnits

Name: UpdateAccountKeys

Name: DataUsage

Name: MongoRequests

Name: RemoveRegion

Description: P99 Replication Latency across source and target regions for geo-enabled account

Name: SqlContainerDelete
Description: Sql Container Deleted

Name: OfflineRegion
Description: Region Offlined

Name: SqlDatabaseDelete
Description: Sql Database Deleted

Name: DiskUsedPercentage
Description: Percent of available disk used in Datastore

Name: UsageAverage
Description: Memory usage as percentage of total configured or available memory

Name: CPU
Description: CPU Usage per Cluster

Name: CPUCritical
Description: CPU Usage per Cluster (Critical)

Name: Memory
Description: Memory Usage per Cluster

Name: MemoryCritical
Description: Memory Usage per Cluster (Critical)

Name: Storage
Description: Storage Usage per Datastore

Name: ConnectionCount
Description: The amount of user connection.

Name: IncomingMessages
Description: Incoming Messages for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: OutgoingMessages
Description: Outgoing Messages for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: ThrottledRequests
Description: Throttled Requests for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: ServerErrors
Description: Server Errors for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: UserErrors
Description: User Errors for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: QuotaExceededErrors
Description: Quota Exceeded Errors for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: NamespaceMemoryUsage
Description: Memory usage metric for Premium SKU namespaces.

Name: NamespaceCpuUsage
Description: CPU usage metric for Premium SKU namespaces.

Name: CaptureBacklog
Description: Capture Backlog for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: IncomingBytes
Description: Incoming Bytes for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: OutgoingBytes
Description: Outgoing Bytes for Microsoft.EventHub.

Name: CPU
Description: CPU utilization for the Event Hub Cluster as a percentage

Name: CpuUsage
Description: CPU usage on all cores in millicores.

Name: MemoryUsage
Description: Total memory usage in byte.

Name: NetworkBytesReceivedPerSecond
Description: The network bytes received per second.

Name: NetworkBytesTransmittedPerSecond
Description: The network bytes transmitted per second.

Name: CpuPercentage
Description: The average CPU used across all instances of the plan.

Name: MemoryPercentage
Description: The average memory used across all instances of the plan.

Name: HttpQueueLength
Description: The average number of HTTP requests that had to sit on the queue before being fulfilled. A high or increasing HTTP Queue length is a symptom of a plan under heavy load.

Name: DiskQueueLength
Description: The average number of both read and write requests that were queued on storage. A high disk queue length is an indication of an app that might be slowing down because of excessive disk I/O.

Name: SocketOutboundAll
Description: The average number of sockets used for outbound connections across all the instances of the plan irrespective of their TCP states. Having too many outbound connections can cause connectivity errors.

Name: TcpTimeWait
Description: The average number of sockets in TIME_WAIT state across all the instances of the plan.

Name: BytesReceived
Description: The average incoming bandwidth used across all instances of the plan.

Name: BytesSent
Description: The average outgoing bandwidth used across all instances of the plan.

Name: TcpEstablished
Description: The average number of sockets in ESTABLISHED state across all the instances of the plan.

Name: AverageResponseTime
Description: The average time taken for the app to serve requests, in seconds. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: CpuTime
Description: The amount of CPU consumed by the app, in seconds. For more information about this metric. Please see https://aka.ms/website-monitor-cpu-time-vs-cpu-percentage (CPU time vs CPU percentage). For WebApps only.

Name: AppConnections
Description: The number of bound sockets existing in the sandbox (w3wp.exe and its child processes). A bound socket is created by calling bind()/connect() APIs and remains until said socket is closed with CloseHandle()/closesocket(). For Windows WebApps and Windows\Linux FunctionApps.  Not available for Linux WebApps.

Name: RequestsInApplicationQueue
Description: The number of requests in the application request queue. For Windows based WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: PrivateBytes
Description: Private Bytes is the current size, in bytes, of memory that the app process has allocated that can't be shared with other processes. For Windows based WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: FileSystemUsage
Description: Percentage of filesystem quota consumed by the app. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: MemoryWorkingSet
Description: The current amount of memory used by the app, in MiB. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Threads
Description: The number of threads currently active in the app process. For Windows based WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Http401
Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 401 status code. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Requests
Description: The total number of requests regardless of their resulting HTTP status code. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: FunctionExecutionCount
Description: Function Execution Count. For FunctionApps only.

Name: BytesSent
Description: The amount of outgoing bandwidth consumed by the app, in MiB. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Http406
Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 406 status code. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Http3xx
Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code >= 300 but < 400. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: WorkflowRunsFailureRate
Description: Workflow Runs Failure Rate. For LogicApps only.

Name: BytesReceived
Description: The amount of incoming bandwidth consumed by the app, in MiB. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: Handles
Description: The total number of handles currently open by the app process. For Windows based WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: FunctionExecutionUnits
Description: Function Execution Units. For FunctionApps only.

Name: WorkflowTriggersFailureRate
Description: Workflow Triggers Failure Rate. For LogicApps only.

Name: Http2xx
Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code >= 200 but < 300. For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: CurrentAssemblies
Description: The current number of Assemblies loaded across all AppDomains in this application. For Windows based WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - Http5xx
Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code >= 500 but < 600.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - HttpResponseTime
Description: The time taken for the app to serve requests, in seconds.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - Http4xx
Description: The count of requests resulting in an HTTP status code >= 400 but < 500.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - AverageMemoryWorkingSet
Description: The average amount of memory used by the app, in megabytes (MiB).  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - HealthCheckStatus
Description: Health check status.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - Http403
Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 403 status code.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: slots - Http404
Description: The count of requests resulting in HTTP 404 status code.  For WebApps and FunctionApps.

Name: IngestionLatencyInSeconds
Description: Latency of data ingested, from the time the data was received in the cluster until it's ready for query. The ingestion latency period depends on the ingestion scenario.

Name: KeepAlive
Description: Sanity check indicates the cluster responds to queries

Name: BlobsDropped
Description: Number of blobs permanently rejected by a component.

Name: IngestionResult
Description: Total number of sources that either failed or succeeded to be ingested. Splitting the metric by status, you can get detailed information about the status of the ingestion operations.

Name: CPU
Description: CPU utilization level

Name: serverLoad
Description: The percentage of cycles in which the Redis server is busy processing and not waiting idle for messages. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: usedmemorypercentage
Description: The percentage of cache memory used for key/value pairs. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: connectedclients
Description: The number of client connections to the cache. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: cacheRead
Description: The amount of data read from the cache in bytes per second. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: percentProcessorTime
Description: The CPU utilization of the Azure Redis Cache server as a percentage. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: allusedmemorypercentage
Description: The percentage of cache memory used for key/value pairs. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: allserverLoad
Description: The percentage of cycles in which the Redis server is busy processing and not waiting idle for messages. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: cacheLatency
Description: The latency to the cache in microseconds. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: errors
Description: The number errors that occured on the cache. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: allpercentprocessortime
Description: The CPU utilization of the Azure Redis Cache server as a percentage. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: usedmemory
Description: The amount of cache memory used for key/value pairs in the cache in MB. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: usedmemoryRss
Description: The amount of cache memory used in MB, including fragmentation and metadata. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: allconnectedclients
Description: The number of client connections to the cache. For more details, see https://aka.ms/redis/metrics.

Name: TotalCalls
Description: Total number of calls.

Name: TotalErrors
Description: Total number of calls with error response (HTTP response code 4xx or 5xx).

Name: Latency
Description: Latency in milliseconds.

Name: SuccessRate
Description: Availability percentage with the following calculation: (Total Calls - Server Errors)/Total Calls. Server Errors include any HTTP responses >=500.

Name: ServerErrors
Description: Number of calls with service internal error (HTTP response code 5xx).

Name: TokenTransaction
Description: Number of Inference Tokens Processed on an OpenAI Model

Name: BlockedCalls
Description: Number of calls that exceeded rate or quota limit.

Name: ClientErrors
Description: Number of calls with client side error (HTTP response code 4xx).

Name: AzureOpenAIContextTokensCacheMatchRate
Description: Percentage of the prompt tokens hit the cache, available for PTU-managed.

Name: AzureOpenAIProvisionedManagedUtilizationV2
Description: Utilization % for a provisioned-managed deployment, calculated as (PTUs consumed / PTUs deployed) x 100.

Name: AzureOpenAITimeToResponse
Description: Recommended latency (responsiveness) measure for streaming requests. Time in milliseconds.

Name: capacityPools/volumes - VolumeConsumedSizePercentage
Description: The percentage of the volume consumed including snapshots.

Name: capacityPools/volumes - VolumeLogicalSize
Description: Logical size of the volume (used bytes)

Name: capacityPools/volumes - AverageWriteLatency
Description: Average write latency in milliseconds per operation

Name: capacityPools/volumes - AverageReadLatency
Description: Average read latency in milliseconds per operation

Name: capacityPools/volumes - CbsVolumeOperationComplete
Description: Did the last volume backup or restore operation complete successfully? 1 if yes, 0 if no.

Name: capacityPools/volumes - VolumeAllocatedSize
Description: The provisioned size of a volume

Name: UnusableNodeCount
Description: Number of unusable nodes

Name: OfflineNodeCount
Description: Number of offline nodes

Name: TaskFailEvent
Description: Total number of tasks that have completed in a failed state

Name: RebootingNodeCount

Name: PreemptedNodeCount
Description: Number of preempted nodes

Name: memory_metric

Description: Metric that logs a value of 1 each time the resigtered server successfully records a heartbeat with the Cloud Endpoint

Name: StorageSyncSyncSessionPerItemErrorsCount

Name: ServerSyncSessionResult
Description: Metric that logs a value of 1 each time the Server Endpoint successfully completes a Sync Session with the Cloud Endpoint

Name: RestoreHealthEvent

Name: StorageUsed for Standard Pricing Plan

Name: SuccessfulPullCount
Description: Number of successful image pulls

Name: SuccessfulPushCount
Description: Number of successful image pushes

Name: StorageUsed
Description: The amount of storage used by the container registry. For a registry account, it's the sum of capacity used by all the repositories within a registry. It's sum of capacity used by shared layers, manifest files, and replica copies in each of its repositories.

Name: Availability

Name: SaturationShoebox

Name: Failed Runs
Description: Number of runs failed for this workspace. Count is updated when a run fails.

Name: Model Deploy Failed
Description: Number of model deployments that failed in this workspace.

Name: Quota Utilization Percentage
Description: Percent of quota utilized.

Name: Unusable Nodes
Description: Number of unusable nodes. Unusable nodes are not functional due to some unresolvable issue. Azure will recycle these nodes.

Name: Not Responding Runs
Description: Number of runs not responding for this workspace. Count is updated when a run enters Not Responding state.

Name: ERGatewayConnectionBitsInPerSecond
Description: Bits per second ingressing Azure via ExpressRoute Gateway.  Applies to VWAN ExpressRoute Gateways.

Name: ERGatewayConnectionBitsOutPerSecond
Description: Bits per second egressing Azure via ExpressRoute Gateway.  Applies to VWAN ExpressRoute Gateways.

Name: ExpressRouteGatewayCpuUtilization
Description: CPU Utilization of the ExpressRoute Gateway.  Applies to VWAN ExpressRoute Gateways.

Name: DatapathAvailability

Name: QosDropBitsOutPerSecond

Name: ApplicationGatewayTotalTime
Description: Time that it takes for a request to be processed and its response to be sent. This is the interval from the time when Application Gateway receives the first byte of an HTTP request to the time when the response send operation finishes. It's important to note that this usually includes the Application Gateway processing time, time that the request and response packets are traveling over the network and the time the backend server took to respond.

Name: Availability
Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

Name: Throttling
Description: The storage account will be throttled if throughput exceeds the account's tier limit. Increasing the file share or storage tier may be necessary.
dimensions: [{"name": "ResponseType", "operator": "Include", "values": ["SuccessWithThrottling SuccessWithShareIopsThrottling ClientShareIopsThrottlingError"]}, {"name": "FileShare", "operator": "Include", "values": ["SuccessWithShareEgressThrottling SuccessWithShareIngressThrottling SuccessWithShareIopsThrottling ClientShareEgressThrottlingError ClientShareIngressThrottlingError ClientShareIopsThrottlingError"]}]

Name: QueueCount
Description: The number of queues in the storage account.

Name: FileShareCount
Description: The number of file shares in the storage account.

Name: UsedCapacity
Description: The amount of storage used by the storage account. For standard storage accounts, it's the sum of capacity used by blob, table, file, and queue. For premium storage accounts and Blob storage accounts, it is the same as BlobCapacity or FileCapacity.
tags: auto-generated, agc-42019, hpc, auto-generated, agc-35128, rag

Name: Egress
Description: The amount of egress data. This number includes egress to external client from Azure Storage as well as egress within Azure. As a result, this number does not reflect billable egress.
tags: auto-generated, agc-3835, hpc, auto-generated, agc-2980, rag

Name: Ingress
Description: The amount of ingress data, in bytes. This number includes ingress from an external client into Azure Storage as well as ingress within Azure.
tags: auto-generated, agc-2468, hpc, auto-generated, agc-2078, rag

Name: blobServices - BlobCapacity
Description: The amount of storage used by the storage account's Blob service in bytes.

Name: blobServices - SuccessE2ELatency
Description: The average end-to-end latency of successful requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation, in milliseconds. This value includes the required processing time within Azure Storage to read the request, send the response, and receive acknowledgment of the response.
tags: auto-generated, agc-504, hpc, auto-generated, agc-496, rag

Name: blobServices - SuccessServerLatency
Description: The average time used to process a successful request by Azure Storage. This value does not include the network latency specified in SuccessE2ELatency.
tags: auto-generated, agc-257, hpc, auto-generated, agc-297, rag

Name: queueServices - QueueMessageCount
Description: The number of unexpired queue messages in the storage account.

Name: queueServices - QueueCapacity
Description: The amount of Queue storage used by the storage account.

Name: fileServices - FileCapacity
Description: The amount of File storage used by the storage account.

Name: fileServices - Transactions
Description: The number of requests made to a storage service or the specified API operation. This number includes successful and failed requests, as well as requests which produced errors. Use ResponseType dimension for the number of different type of response.
tags: auto-generated, agc-1467, hpc, auto-generated, agc-1507, rag

Name: fileServices - FileShareSnapshotCount
Description: The number of snapshots present on the share in storage account's Files Service.

Name: fileServices - Availability
Description: The percentage of availability for the storage service or the specified API operation. Availability is calculated by taking the TotalBillableRequests value and dividing it by the number of applicable requests, including those that produced unexpected errors. All unexpected errors result in reduced availability for the storage service or the specified API operation.

Name: fileServices - FileShareCapacityQuota
Description: The upper limit on the amount of storage that can be used by Azure Files Service in bytes.
